meanings.definition: A faint design made in some paper during manufacture, visible when held against the light.
meanings.sent1: The watermark on the paper showed a delicate pattern when light passed through.
meanings.sent2: I could see the watermark on the certificate when I held it up to the window.
meanings.sent3: The detective examined the ransom note, looking for a hidden watermark that could reveal the culprit.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were like a watermark, always present but sometimes fading into the background.
meanings.sent5: The watermark on the document was so intricate, it seemed like a secret code.

meanings.definition: A distinguishing mark or symbol imprinted on paper to identify its authenticity.
meanings.sent1: The watermark on the currency ensured its genuineness.
meanings.sent2: The watermark on the painting confirmed its originality.
meanings.sent3: The cat wore a tiny watermark on its collar, making it look like a special pet.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a watermark, a unique signature of her happiness.
meanings.sent5: The watermark on the letter was like a seal of approval, guaranteeing its legitimacy.
